intro: Polycarpaea, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to sub-Saharan Africa. The plants typically have palmately compound leaves and produce showy, yellow or orange flowers. They are often found in grassy or open habitats and are adapted to dry conditions. Polycarpaea species are sometimes used in traditional medicine and horticulture.
